document.heading: Executive Service Residency Requirement Amendment Act of 1999

history.narrative: Law 13-84, the “Executive Service Residency Requirement Amendment Act of 1999,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-414, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 2, 1999, and December 7, 1999, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 22, 1999, it was assigned Act No. 13-216 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-84 became effective on April 12, 2000.
